For face\\_1, create a loop (loop\\_1) with the following curves: * line\\_1: + Start Point: [0.0, 0.0] + End Point: [0.072, 0.0] * line\\_2: + Start Point: [0.072, 0.0] + End Point: [0.072, 0.036] * line\\_3: + Start Point: [0.072, 0.036] + End Point: [0.678, 0.036] * line\\_4: + Start Point: [0.678, 0.036] + End Point: [0.678, 0.0] * line\\_5: + Start Point: [0.678, 0.0] + End Point: [0.75, 0.0] * line\\_6: + Start Point: [0.75, 0.0] + End Point: [0.75, 0.09] * line\\_7: + Start Point: [0.75, 0.09] + End Point: [0.0, 0.09] * line\\_8: + Start Point: [0.0, 0.09] + End Point: [0.0, 0.0] Note that loop\\_1 is a closed loop consisting of 8 line segments. Complete the 3D Solid Transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and translation vector defined earlier. Extrude the 2D sketch along its normal vector by 0.15 units. This will create a 3D solid from the 2D sketch. The 3D solid is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The prism is centered on a vertical axis. The height of the prism is 0.15 units, the width is 0.15 units, and the length (measured along the horizontal) is 0.75 units. Do not apply any boolean operations at this stage. Description The shape is described as 'A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The prism is centered on a vertical axis.'. The length is 0.75 units, the width is 0.15 units, and the height is 0.15 units.</description>
